item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec 2025 Results Show Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has revealed a nuanced picture across Indian equities, with 4,084 companies reporting results. While the overall proportion of positive earnings outcomes has inched up to 46.0%, sectoral and market-capitalisation distinctions highlight a complex landscape for investors navigating growth and value opportunities. Time: 12 minutes ago

item.title: Are Impex Ferro Tech Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: Impex Ferro Tech Ltd's latest results are concerning, with net sales of ₹0.00 crore for three consecutive quarters and a net loss of ₹1.81 crores, indicating severe operational and financial challenges without a clear path to recovery. The company's high debt-to-equity ratio and negative book value further reflect investor pessimism about its future. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Are Sparc Electrex Ltd latest results good or bad?
item.description: Sparc Electrex Ltd's latest Q3 FY26 results are poor, showing a net loss of ₹0.97 crores and a 93.94% decline in revenues, indicating severe operational challenges and a need for strategic reassessment. The company's financial metrics reflect significant inefficiencies and ongoing cash burn, raising concerns about its viability. Time: 2 hours ago

item.title: Eureka Forbes Ltd Forms Death Cross, Signalling Potential Bearish Trend
item.description: Eureka Forbes Ltd has recently formed a Death Cross, a significant technical indicator where the 50-day moving average crosses below the 200-day moving average. This development signals a potential shift towards a bearish trend, reflecting deteriorating momentum and raising concerns about the stock’s long-term strength amid underwhelming market performance. Time: 3 hours ago

item.title: Quarterly Earnings Review: Dec-2025 Results Reveal Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarter earnings season has concluded for 4,083 stocks, revealing a nuanced picture of corporate performance across market capitalisations and sectors. While the proportion of companies reporting positive results has edged up slightly to 46.0%, the overall trend remains subdued, reflecting ongoing challenges in the broader economic environment. Time: 3 hours ago

item.title: Ecos (India) Mobility & Hospitality Ltd Falls to 52-Week Low Amidst Underperformance
item.description: Ecos (India) Mobility & Hospitality Ltd has recently touched a 52-week low, closing just 1.2% above its lowest price of Rs 160.95. This significant price level reflects a period of sustained underperformance relative to both its sector and broader market indices. Time: 4 hours ago

item.title: Mankind Pharma Ltd Stock Falls to 52-Week Low Amidst Underperformance
item.description: Mankind Pharma Ltd’s shares have declined to a fresh 52-week low, closing near Rs 2,029.35, marking a significant downturn in the stock’s performance over the past year. This decline reflects a combination of subdued financial results and valuation concerns amid broader market pressures. Time: 4 hours ago
